Hmm...ok...slight addendum...I do happen to like being able to open 
up a web page provided with something download from sourceforge and 
being able to quickly browse through to answer a specific question 
(like how do I call X within this class I downloaded).  So I suppose 
they have their uses.  I just don't want my code cluttered with the 
stuff.  I'd rather run some tool against my clean code that generates 
the HTML pages for me (which are out there...and/or built into 
several of the IDEs currently in use).

-Eric

--- In junit@y..., Eric Heikkila <ericheikkila@y...> wrote:
> I hate documentation in general...most of it sucks,
> and the stuff that doesn't suck is usually either
> useless or out of date.  I'd rather have the unit
> tests than javadocs any day. ;)
> 
> -Eric
>
